en: And when David was a little past the top of the ascent, behold, Ziba the servant of Mephibosheth met him, with a couple of asses saddled, and upon them two hundred loaves of bread, and a hundred clusters of raisins, and a hundred of summer fruits, and a bottle of wine.
hmr: David chun tlâng sîp lâwn suokna a khêl dep chun, ngai ta, Mephiboseth siehlaw Ziba chun a lo tuok a, sabengtung pahni a hmang a, bei tlang zahni le grêp emṭâwl bâwr za le nipui thei za le uoin peng khat ân phurtir a.

en: And the king said unto Ziba, What meanest thou by these? And Ziba said, The asses are for the king’s household to ride on; and the bread and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine, that such as are faint in the wilderness may drink.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Ziba kuoma chun, “Hieng hi iengtizie am a nih a?” a ta. Ziba chun, “Sabengtunghai hi lal sûnghai chuongna ding nîng a ta, bei le nipui theihai hi tlangvâlhai fâk ding nîng a ta; uoin hi chu thlalêra châu taphawthai dâwn ding nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: And the king said, And where is thy master’s son? And Ziba said unto the king, Behold, he abideth at Jerusalem; for he said, To-day will the house of Israel restore me the kingdom of my father.
hmr: Chun, lal chun “Anleh, i pu naupa chu khâwlai am?” a ta. Ziba chun lal kuomah, “Ngai ta, Jerusa- lemah a um, ‘Vawisûn hin Israel- hai chun ka pa ram an mi pêk nâwk ding a nih,’ a ti nghe nghe annâw,” a ta.

en: Then said the king to Ziba, Behold, thine is all that pertaineth unto Mephibosheth. And Ziba said, I do obeisance; let me find favor in thy sight, my lord, O king.
hmr: Chun, lal chun Ziba kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, Mephiboseth thil nei po po chu i ta vawng a ni tah,” a ta. Chun, Ziba chun, “Chibai ka bûk takzet che a nih, aw lalpa ka pu, i mit tlunga um pei tum ka tih,” a ta.

en: And when king David came to Bahurim, behold, there came out thence a man of the family of the house of Saul, whose name was Shimei, the son of Gera; he came out, and cursed still as he came.
hmr: Chun, lal Davidin Bahurim a tlung chun, ngai ta, Saula sûnghai laia mi Gera naupa a hming Simei a hung suok a, ṭawngsie inphur pum peiin a hung suok a.

en: And he cast stones at David, and at all the servants of king David: and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left.
hmr: David chu lungin a dêng a, lal David siehlawhai po po khawm chu; chun, mipui po po le sipai huoisenhai po po chu a changtieng le a vawitieng an um a.

en: And thus said Shimei when he cursed, Begone, begone, thou man of blood, and base fellow:
hmr: Chun, Simei chun ṭawngsie ân phur sûng chun hieng hin a hril a, “Fe hmang dai rawh, fe hmang dai rawh, nang thisen insuo hmang le Belial mihriempa,

en: Jehovah hath returned upon thee all the blood of the house of Saul, in whose stead thou hast reigned; and Jehovah hath delivered the kingdom into the hand of Absalom thy son; and, behold, thou art taken in thine own mischief, because thou art a man of blood.
hmr: a rorêl âi i rêl tah Saula sûnghai thisen chu LALPAIN i chungah a hung inlettir tah a; chun, LALPAIN ram chu i naupa Absalom chu a pêk tah a; chun, ngai ta, thisen insuo- hmang i ni leiin nangma pawi chu nang bawkin i tâwk a nih,” a ta.

en: Then said Abishai the son of Zeruiah unto the king, Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? let me go over, I pray thee, and take off his head.
hmr: Chuongchun, Zeruia naupa Abisai chun lal kuomah, “Iengdinga hi ui thitlaw hin ka lalpa lal chu ṭawngsie ân phur mei mei am a nih a? a lu va tan el ka tih aw?” a ta.

en: And the king said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah? Because he curseth, and because Jehovah hath said unto him, Curse David; who then shall say, Wherefore hast thou done so?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal chun, “Nangni Zeruia naupasalhai, nangni mi lo hrietpêk ding ieng am a um a? LALPAIN a kuomah, ‘David chu ṭawngsie inphur rawh,’ a ti si chun inphur el raw se, ‘Iengdinga chuong anga i thaw am a ni leh?’ tuin am ti hlak an ta?” a ta.

en: And David said to Abishai, and to all his servants, Behold, my son, who came forth from my bowels, seeketh my life: how much more may this Benjamite now do it? let him alone, and let him curse; for Jehovah hath bidden him.
hmr: Chun, David chun Abisai le a siehlawhai po po kuoma chun, “Ngai ta u, ka naupa ka rîla ra ngei chun mi that a tum a na, hi Benjamin mi hin a va tum nasa nâwk zuol âwm de! Ieng- khawm law naw unla, ṭawngsie chu inphur el raw se; LALPA inthawtir a ni sih a.

en: It may be that Jehovah will look on the wrong done unto me, and that Jehovah will requite me good for his cursing of me this day.
hmr: LALPA chun ka rimsikzie hi hung hmûng a ta. LALPA chun vawi- sûna hienga ṭawngsie a mîn phur hi a ṭha tiengin a mi hung thung el khawm a ni thei a nih,” a ta.

en: So David and his men went by the way; and Shimei went along on the hill-side over against him, and cursed as he went, and threw stones at him, and cast dust.
hmr: Chuongchun, David le a mihai chu lampuia chun an fe pei tah a; chun, Simei chu an râla tlâng panga chun a fe ve pei a, a fe malam chun ṭawngsie chu ân phur pei a, lunghai dâmin a dêng a, pilvut dâmin a theh a.

en: And the king, and all the people that were with him, came weary; and he refreshed himself there.
hmr: Chun, lal le a kuoma mi um po pohai chun Aiphim an tlung a, chu- taka chun an châwldam tah a.

en: And Absalom, and all the people, the men of Israel, came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel with him.
hmr: Chun, Absalom le mipui po po, Israel mihai chu Jerusalemah an feh a, chun, a kuomah Ahithophel khawm a ṭhang a.

en: And it came to pass, when Hushai the Archite, David’s friend, was come unto Absalom, that Hushai said unto Absalom, Long live the king, Long live the king.
hmr: Ark mi Husai, David ruolpa chun Absalom kuom a tlung chun, Husai chun Absalom kuomah, “Pa- thienin laltak humhim raw se, Pathienin laltak humhim raw se,” a ta.

en: And Absalom said to Hushai, Is this thy kindness to thy friend? why wentest thou not with thy friend?
hmr: Chun, Absalom chun Husai kuomah, “Hieng ang hi a ni maw i ruol i lunginsiet dân chu? Iengdinga i ruolpa kuoma i fe naw am?” a ta.

en: And Hushai said unto Absalom, Nay; but whom Jehovah, and this people, and all the men of Israel have chosen, his will I be, and with him will I abide.
hmr: Chun, Husai chun Absalom kuomah, “Fe naw ning ah, LALPA le hieng mipui le Israelhaiin an ithlang thu thuin um ka ta, a kuomah um lem ka tih.

en: And again, whom should I serve? should I not serve in the presence of his son? as I have served in thy father’s presence, so will I be in thy presence.
hmr: Chun, tu rawng am ka bâwl ding a na? Naupa hmaah rawng ka bâwl ding a ni naw am a nih? I pa hmaa rawng ka bâwl ang khan i hmaah bâwl ka tih,” a ta.

en: Then said Absalom to Ahithophel, Give your counsel what we shall do.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom chun Ahithophel kuoma chun, “Iengtin am ka thaw ding a na, i ngaidân hril ta?” a ta.

en: And Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Go in unto thy father’s concubines, that he hath left to keep the house; and all Israel will hear that thou art abhorred of thy father: then will the hands of all that are with thee be strong.
hmr: Chun, Ahithophel chun Absa- lom kuomah, “I pa thaikêm in nghâk- a siea umhai kuoma chun va lût rawh; chun, Israel mi po poin i pain a thîm che ti hrieng an ta, chuong- chun, nanga tienga ṭhang po po- hai kut chu a hung hrât ding a nih,” a ta.

en: So they spread Absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and Absalom went in unto his father’s concubines in the sight of all Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Absalom ta ding chun in chungah puon in an zar a; chuongchun, Israel mi po pohai mithmuah a pa thâikêmhai kuoma chun a lût a.

en: And the counsel of Ahithophel, which he gave in those days, was as if a man inquired at the oracle of God: so was all the counsel of Ahithophel both with David and with Absalom.
hmr: Chuong laia rem a ruot, Ahithophel remruothai chu, Pathien thu ngai anga ngai a ni hlak a, chuong ang bawk chun, Ahithophelin David le Absalom rem a ruotpuihai po po chu ngai a ni hlak.
